Reinforcement Learning

25 May 2023 - less than 1 min read time
Tags: Deep-Learning DQN

Introduction

Deep-Q Network, abbrievated as DQN, is a reinforcement learning method first proposed by DeepMind where a convolution neural network is trained using Q-Learning. Q-Learning (q for quality) is a reinforcement learning algorithm that tries to learn the “quality” of the next action in terms of maximizing future rewards. Ideally, we reward the agent for every step that it takes so that it can better understand which moves were better or worse. The rewards can vary depending on a variety of factors such as current environment, time surpassed, the preceding environment etc. and the goal is to have the agent learn what happens in between starting and “finishing” a game or completing a quest.

 V(s)=\max {a}\left(R(s, a) +  \gamma \sum{s^{\prime}} P\left(s, a, s^{\prime}\right) V\left(s^{\prime}\right)\right)
